Maldives says Chinese vessel will not conduct research in its watersA Chinese research vessel on its way to the Maldives will not conduct any research while in the archipelago's waters in the Indian Ocean, the Maldivian foreign ministry said on Tuesday. Tue, 23 Jan 2024 14:29:11 GMT YRMSOYO2FFODVOPVMOADWShaiy https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/maldives-says-chinese-vessel-will-not-conduct-research-its-waters-2024-01-23/Reuters世界亚太地区

Tennis-Alcaraz gears up for Zverev examination in MelbourneSecond seed Carlos Alcaraz faces arguably the toughest test of his Australian Open campaign when he faces Germany's Alexander Zverev in the quarter-finals at Melbourne Park on Wednesday, in a match that promises to be a fascinating clash of styles. Philippines Marcos says does not endorse Taiwan independence, seeks to avoid conflictPhilippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr said he does not endorse Taiwan independence and reiterated his country was committed to its One-China policy, a response to China's outrage over recent remarks in congratulating Taiwan's election winner. P&G cuts annual profit forecast on slowing price hikes, Gillette business writedownProcter & Gamble cut its annual profit forecast on Tuesday following a writedown in the value of its Gillette business in December and as the boost from earlier price hikes starts to fade in the United States. Italy looks to use G7 chair to boost support for Ukraine, scrutinise AIItaly will use its presidency of the Group of Seven major democracies to challenge growing perceptions that Russia is winning in Ukraine and that the West is tiring of the war, a source familiar with Italy's G7 plans said. Exclusive: Fortescue faces rare delays for China iron ore customs clearance - sourcesAt least two iron ore cargoes from the world's No.4 supplier Fortescue Metals Group are facing unusual customs delays at north China's Caofeidian port due to inspections for solid waste, sources with knowledge of the matter said. China undergoes rare scrutiny of rights record at UN meetingChina underwent scrutiny of its human rights record at a U.N. meeting on Tuesday, with mostly Western countries calling for protections for Xinjiang Uyghurs and greater freedom in Hong Kong which Beijing dismissed as guidance based on lies. Bank of America cuts 20 staff in Asia, China-focused bankers affected most- sourcesBank of America on Tuesday announced job cuts of around 20 bankers in Asia, three sources with knowledge of the matter said, as plunging markets in China and Hong Kong weighed on deal prospects.
